Merge pull request #133 from nelenkov/zipped-export-dev

Implements exporting/importing stats in a zip file.

Added a new BaseDetailsActitity and moved all the code from BaseActivity that is used in the details views (Comments, Downloads etc...) into the new activity. This also allowed some duplicated code from the CommentsActivity, AdmobActivity etc to be removed. LoginActivity no longer extends BaseActivity as it has no need to. I'm also using Utils.execute() for some tasks to avoid a delay on HC+ when switching accounts and when scrolling through apps during the initial load.
Re-enable ACRA

WIP: Moved most preferences to be global and created a new account specific preference activity

Added a loader in place of the refresh button as discussed in #141

This looks a lot better than the default infinite progressbar in ABS,
as it appears on the action item. This has a small downside when in
landscape though. As it can't show the text when it has an ActionView,
in some cases it'll have 'enough room' to show both the export and import
action items. Causing the account picker to be a tad smaller in some cases.
In my opinion the import and export shouldn't even be in the ActionBar as
they aren't exactly features a user uses a lot.

Merge branch 'master' into dev

Using the NotificationCompat2 library and added some debugging

Don't use this build unless you know what you're doing, it doesn't
save anything, it's purely to test notifications really.
Merge branch 'master' into dev

A basic implementation of JB notifications

All it really does now is show the normal text in a BigText, meaning that
if it's long and isn't fully readable you can expand it (on JB that is) to
read everything. It'll also show the account name it's for in the summary.
I also re-enabled the writing to the database so everyone can really test
this build without it not working properly. Note that this is just the
beginning, I'm planning on doing a lot more with this.
Showing the app icon of the first app in the list

Merge pull request #153 from willlunniss/dev

Fixed getting 'No published apps found' toasts due to accountName being ...

Using the hashCode() of the accountName as notification id

This will allow for multiple notifications for multiple accounts,
this was requested by @willunniss and it makes more sense too as
the summary of the big text on JB will show the account name. As
it uses hashCode() it'll override any notifications from the account
that are already there.
Naming our NotificationManager nm instead of an mXXX name variable
